page.title: 16Marton Abbey
page.content: Marton Abbey was a double house for Augustinian Canons and Nuns about 1150-1160 in the time of Bertram de Bulmer. Nuns later moved to Moxby (then called Mousby) where tey formed a Nunnery on land given to them by Henry II. It was devastated by the scots in 1322, rebuilt in 1536. No surviving remain above ground of Priory buildings. Numerous mounds in fields around the old abbey. The Abbey is now a working DAiry Farm run by the Atkinson family. Built into the Farmhouse are sculptured fragments including two crowned shields with the letters I H C on them. Thick front wall has a fine angel corbel, the angel bearing scroll inscribed laudo nomen..Prior Mills (now called Abbey Mills) are now demolished,but remains remain.
